metadata.title: CVE-2024-42160 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:f2fs: check validation of fault attrs in f2fs_build_fault_attr()- It missed to check validation of fault attrs in parse_options(),let's fix to add check condition in f2fs_build_fault_attr().- Use f2fs_build_fault_attr() in __sbi_store() to clean up code.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-42160` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1003.3').
